userreviews.userReview: I'd never heard of this poet, but ordered the chapbook as part of a "book bundle" deal offered by the publisher (where I also published a chapbook). I thought the poems were marvelous - sometimes collage-like, sometimes funny and spot on, and often ended with a brilliant last line, such as "When I looked again, the clouds were just where I left them." ("Meanwhile at the Lava Flow")or "It was a matter of time / like chopping is a matter of axes." ("Much Later")or"the four a.m. sadness beds down in its own fur." (At the Heart of it Was a Quantum Event")The poems are all pretty short, some just five or six lines long. I don't think any of the poems in here are available online. I did find this (not from this chapbook) on Verse Daily: http://www.versedaily.org/2008/robins...and this - http://www.wmich.edu/newissues/titles...from a review of a full-length book of Samyn's, which I'll likely order.

title: The Boom of a Small Cannon
